001package Calibration_Demos;
002
003import java.awt.Color;
004import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
005
006import ij.IJ;
007import ij.ImagePlus;
008import ij.ImageStack;
009import ij.io.LogStream;
010import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
011import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
012import imagingbook.calibration.data.zhang.CalibrationImage;
013import imagingbook.calibration.data.zhang.ZhangData;
014import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.Camera;
015import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.ViewTransform;
016import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util.GridPainter;
017import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
018import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
019
020
021/**
022 * This plugin projects opens an image stack containing the 5 Zhang
023 * test images and projects the model points into each view,
024 * using the (known) camera and view parameters.
025 * All data are part of Zhang's demo data set that comes with the
026 * EasyCalib program. NO CALIBRATION is performed here!
027 * 
028 * @author W. Burger
029 * @version 2022/04/14
030 */
031public class Demo_Zhang_Projection implements PlugIn {
032        
033        static ImageResource resource = CalibrationImage.CalibImageStack_tif;
034        
035        static Color BackGroundColor = Color.white;
036        static Color LineColor = Color.magenta;
037        static boolean BeVerbose = false;
038        
039        static {
040                LogStream.redirectSystem();
041                PrintPrecision.set(6);
042        }
043        
044
045        public void run(String arg0) {
046                // open the test image (stack):
047                ImagePlus testIm = resource.getImage();
048                if (testIm == null) {
049                        IJ.error("Could not open calibration images!");
050                        return;
051                }
052                testIm.show();
053                
054                // get the 3D model points:
055                Point2D[] modelPoints = ZhangData.getModelPoints();
056                
057                // get the camera intrinsics (typically by calibration):
058                Camera camera = ZhangData.getCameraIntrinsics();
059                
060                // get all view parameters (extrinsics):
061                ViewTransform[] views = ZhangData.getAllViewTransforms();
062                int M = views.length;
063
064                // project and draw the model into the views:
065                ImageStack stack = testIm.getStack();
066                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
067                        // project the model points:
068                        Point2D[] projectedPoints = camera.project(views[i], modelPoints);
069                        ImageProcessor ip = stack.getProcessor(i + 1);
070                        // draw the squares:
071                        GridPainter painter = new GridPainter(ip);
072                        painter.lineCol = LineColor;
073                        painter.drawSquares(projectedPoints);
074                }
075                testIm.updateAndDraw();
076        }
077
078}
